column2: All Saints netball team was out in full force over the Easter holidays as a 14-strong squad travelled to the Spanish resort of Salou for the 2007 UK university tour, scooping second place in the competition.

column1: The two day tournament got off to a flying start for the girls as victories over Hull and Leicester, and two closely fought defeats to Worcester and Strathclyde, saw Leeds Trinity competing at the top of their group.

column2: s first group match saw them annihilate Hull. A fantastic  performance from goal shooter Jessica &ldquo
column4: Yoxel helped Trinity to a blazing 9-2 victory.

column1: Day two began with a disappointing defeat, when a highly-rated Swansea side took advantage of a cautious Leeds Trinity team and took all three points in a 6-2 win.
The bad luck continued for the netballers, who were clearly finding it difficult to adjust their style to the overly strict umpires.
Birmingham, who had skipped the qualifying stages due to complaints of low competitive standards, went on to take a further three points following a 5-2 victory over the Leeds side.
However a 7-4 win against Sussex and a forfeit from Durham University saw the Leeds Trinity team finish runners up, capping off a successful tour.
Leeds Trinity tour captain, Maxine Whittingstall, had nothing but praise for her squad as she spoke of their effort and enthusiasm. She said, &ldquo
column2: We have not had  our preferred starting seven out here with us, but everyone gave it 100%.&rdquo
